snippet: The United Nations’ decision to pause observers’ work was the most severe blow yet to a wobbly peace plan world powers had seen as the best chance to solve Syria’s deadly conflict.
abstract: United Nations suspends its observer mission in Syria, citing escalating violence; suspension is the most severe blow yet to months of international efforts to negotiate a peace plan and prevent Syria’s descent into civil war.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and DAVID E. SANGER
byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick reported from Cairo, and David E. Sanger from Washington. Neil MacFarquhar, Hwaida Saad and Dalal Mawad contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The United Nations’ decision to pause observers’ work was the most severe blow yet to a wobbly peace plan world powers had seen as the best chance to solve Syria’s deadly conflict.

headline.seo: U.N. Suspends Its Mission in Syria, Citing Violence
headline.main: U.N. Suspends Syria Mission, Citing Increase in Violence
headline.print_headline: U.N. Suspending Syrian Mission, Citing Violence

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
